title: Inclusive Mathematics Education Design Based on Multiple Intelligences

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and self-directed learning experience as an adult learner
context.additional_context: Mobile Math Education Course in a Smartphone-Based Environment Requiring Inclusive Instructional Design Considering Diverse Intelligence Types. Focus on Practical Math Application Skills for Job Seekers

learning_goals: Learners can recognize their dominant intelligences based on multiple intelligences theory and apply them to mathematics learning.
Learners apply mathematical problem-solving strategies through mobile content developed according to Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles.
Learners experience mathematics learning methods that utilize diverse intelligence domains beyond linguistic and logical-mathematical intelligences (e.g., bodily-kinesthetic, spatial intelligence).

resources: Learning Materials by Multiple Intelligence Types
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
